name: Radiation-Induced Esophagitis
chief_complaint: Painful swallowing and chest discomfort after radiation therapy
physical_findings: No visible oral or pharyngeal lesions
treatment: Dietary modification (soft foods, avoid acidic/spicy foods)
Temporary radiation treatment adjustment if severe
prognosis: Generally resolves within 2-4 weeks after completing radiation therapy with proper management
description: Inflammation of the esophageal mucosa caused by radiation therapy, typically occurring 2-3 weeks into treatment for thoracic malignancies. The severity often correlates with radiation dose and volume of esophagus irradiated.
risk_factors: Large volume of esophagus in treatment field
